review: My daughter would give it 5 stars, (7 yrs old) which is precisely the reason we go here although we try to avoid it.  If you can stand all the sodium, the burgers are decent  and the chicken breast  is moist and flavorful. The margaritas are good, come during HH if you must come!

Ya know, it's Chili's.  My only issue with them is that they have a serious problem with their employees, chain-wide, not respecting vegetarian's requests to not have meat in their food.  I got served a real burger instead of a veggie burger once, which was probably the server's fault.  I order a salad with the black bean patty on top instead of chicken, but numerous times, little chops of chicken make their way into my salad.  I want to think I've caught all of them, but I probably haven't.  Be careful, y'all, especially in Austin.  You should know better. If you check in on Foursquare and show your server, you get free chips and salsa.  The one appetizer two entrees for $20 isn't a bad deal, either.

We always sit in the bar area at lunch and the bartender is always nice and provides good service. The fact that for the last 15+ years I have ordered the same burger at Chili's and even though it is no longer on the menu, they always make it for me (love) - Ground peppercorn burger ftw!

Chili's is Chili's, I enjoy going once in a while. The food is what you  would expect. Sevice was a little slow, but I think they were understaffed for a busy Saturday afternoon. Overall I enjoyed my food and visiting with friends.
Shiner BBQ burger was actually pretty damn good. They cook burgers medium well FYI. Ask for a different temp and they'll do it.

I get more and more disappointed with Chili's every passing year. They keep cutting costs and quality while raising their prices. Unfortunately, there are few places in Cedar Park that aren't drive through open passed 9 pm. I tend to go in on the later side, order "to go" from the bar, and have a drink while I wait. This Chili's does get points for the bar and the regulars that make it a bit more comfortable while waiting for my order; however, orders do seem to take longer than they should. Will I go back? More than likely since my options are limited, but if I lived in Austin with access to late night options, I'd skip Chili's and hit up a mom and pop with better food and more ambiance.

We came in here because the restaurant across the street was full. I was suprised of how empty it was...I now understand why.  The food is bland and tasteless. I am amazed at how a simple -basic- dish like Fajitas can be done so poorly.  They had the NCAA game on, and while there was little to no one watching it, had the game audio on. That's fair, however highly annoying when commercials were on. Only good thing was our server who was very amicable and nice. First and last time here for sure.

I had a really great experience here on Saturday.  I walked in around 2PM with my daughter in tow.  As we were being seated my child spotted a balloonist rushing by our table.  Of course, she wanted a balloon animal and I reassured her that we'd do our best to secure one before we left.  Sadly, that was not meant to be.  The lady was actually running out of Chili's and leaving for the day, which I didn't know. Later, when I asked my server, Justin, about her he confirmed that she had in fact left.  Well, needless to say my daughter was very upset. Justin to the rescue! He brought my kiddo a hot fudge sundae and he even brought over a balloon that another child had forgotten.  My kiddo couldn't have been happier. He made her day and in turn made mine, too.   The food was ok but the service was great!
Great cheap food and drinks. Waitress was very attentive and made sure every step of the dining experience was satisfactory.

It's chili's. There really isn't that much more to say. My steak was decent, but my friends and I were made to feel as if we weren't welcome to order more or stay once we were bearing the end of our meal.

I have been going to Chili's for a decade or so - and they do have a few dishes that I CRAVE. I mean, the avocado ranch dip is like Christmas in a cup.  The cajun chicken pasta is sinfully good. My other go to dish are the southwest eggrolls - with extra avocado ranch. What i most often is the mushroom jack fajitas - you wont find it on the menu, but if you ask they will make it for you. How can you go wrong with chicken, mushrooms, bacon, and onions???  and they have my favorite dessert of all time - molten chocolate brownie & ice cream. Chili's isnt a 5 star culinary experience, so just dont expect it to be!!   Vicky is my favorite server!

This is a great spot! This is my new favorite location - Danny was our server and he did an awesome job! He let me know about the 2 for 20$ and other great specials going on - I had the sirloin and it was cooked to my specifications - I am full and happy! I will be Back

Terrible experience overall. Poor quality food, incorrect orders, and slow service. I'm surprised because I've been here before and it's usually ok, but this was the worst. They weren't even very busy so I don't understand but I won't be back anytime soon!

Lacking Cisco food. Terrible management. Blah servers & bar. I will not be coming here again & I am definitely doing pluckers next time. The only reason I came here was because I had a coupon, witch they didnt even honor. So I just chalked it up to a total loss.

Oh so sad. Chili's, where have you gone? The taste. That atmosphere. The....anything. Triple Dipper....Triple D.... Triple Disappointment I knew before I went I would regret it and I did. Didn't even finish my Honey Chipotle Chicken Crispers. Used to be my go to meal there. A looong time ago now. After tip $70.88 for a family of two adults and 4 small kids. None of us finished our food. Sad face. Only good thing was the third girl who stopped by our table and ended up taking care of us (Eleasha) - She was amazing and did what she could, but no outstanding waitress can make up for a total lack in quality when it comes to the food.

I don't know what happened to Chili's. I used to like this place years ago, then I just dealt with it, and now I will never return.  Let me get this part straight - service: best thing this place has going for it. Period. There really is not much more to say. Seriously. The food was very bland - to the point where the side of me that doesn't like to waste food was like "okay, bud, you have had enough. No more please."  The monterey chicken, was overcooked and dry. There was no flavor other than the bbq sauce. Even the bacon on top was tasteless (how?).  Even our kids didn't want to eat their meals - are you kidding me? How do you jack up quesadillas and fruit? With tip, $70 for the five us, which really we only get enough for about four. NOPE never again - we didn't even take leftovers home.

The absolute worst service and food I have ever had. Then I check my account today and was charged my meal and some strangers or my guess one of the employees friends who left a tab open. Well I am dealing with the situation because that is a felony to charge someones card without permission.

Honestly, this place is horrible. Service, food, and management. I have always in the past got the Cajun shrimp pasta. I ordered it like usual and I got a completely different meal. Not sure how you get a whole meal mixed up. Then take the food back and get my what I ordered and yet still bring me the wrong order. Service was slow when it wasn't busy. The server didn't tell me his name and he looked and me and my boyfriend as if "oh great another teenage couple" when in reality we weren't. So to sum it up this place needs work and a lot of work.

bummer. slow night...or so we thought  we went for a quick bite. The server brought us drinks but never returned. 20 minutes later we used the self service check out. That was the highlight. Bummer! Thank god for OG!

Had a REALLY bad experience at this Chili's last night, so I won't be returning.  Since I can't give a no-star rating, I gave it a 1-star.  Here's why: 1) The waitress didn't listen to us when she took our drink order, so she managed to screw that up. 2) The tortilla chips tasted bitter, a sign that they need to clean the fryer, and they were too salty. 3) The waitress brought out a bowl of moldy cheese with my fajitas, and when I said something about it she tried to pass it off as "Jack cheese".  Regular Monterrey jack doesn't have grey/blue spots on it. 4) The quality of the food was way below what I expect from Chili's.  Did I happen to mention that I am a chef by trade? I've been coming to this Chili's for a number of years now, and the quality of the food and service has steadily declined.  I rate this on par with the Applebee's around the corner.  I don't recommend that place, either.

5 Stars - for our favorite bartender/server Richie!  Service is always fantastic when we get him.  Richie is attentive and friendly!   4 Stars - the good is great! They have a 2 for $20 menu.  You can never go wrong with the grilled chicken salad, mango tilapia and honey chipotle chicken crispers! This deal comes with 2 entrees and an appetizer. 3 Stars - cleanliness of the restaurant.  Sometimes it's a hit or miss.  Tables usually need a more thorough wipe down.

Just finished eating at the Chili's in Cedar Park on Pecan Park Blvd. Used to come to this location quite a lot but they just lost my business! Crowd was quite small for a Friday night and we were seated very quickly.  Server was friendly but completely unattentive throughout the entire meal. Initial round of drinks took almost 10 minutes to get to us. When the server dropped off the meal she took right back off. When I noticed that my enchiladas had sour cream sauce instead of green chile sauce, she was nowhere to be found. Being very hungry I just started eating my meal. Our daughter got up and asked another server to have a manager come see us at our table. Well over 15 minutes later our server showed back up and I explained that my meal had come out incorrect but we were wondering why she had disappeared. She stated that she was helping out in the back (not taking care of her paying customers). She did apologize and offered to put together a to-go meal of the correct meal and comp'd the incorrect meal. Another couple minutes later (and nearly 20 minutes after our initial request) the manager on-duty came by our table. This guy said he was sorry and fed us some line that they were running out of things in the back (which was not the issue what-so-ever). Not a sincere apology from this guy at all, just more like (I'll do my duty and apologize and move on). When I explained to him about the unattentiveness of our server he said he would look in to it. I highly doubt that! I won't be eating in that neighborhood at Chili's for a long time!

Now I see why the ratings were bad and no one was there at 10pm on a Friday night.  Our server was nice. The food was terrible I got spicy shrimp tacos with rice and beans. Shrimp was okay not spicy at all, not even mild. Everything about/in the tacos were gross.The avacado slices were like sliced bricks (not ripe!). Tortillas were dried out. I got to the point where I dumped out everything from each taco and literally just picked out and ate the shrimp. The beans were ehhh okay. Rice tasted like it had been sitting out for a while. This is the worst Chili's I have ever came across! The empty parking lot made me think they were closed early..should have went with that first warning. I feel like throwing up right now just so I can go eat at pluckers next door. Lol avoid this Chili's people!
Appreciate the gesture... Thank you Chili's for remembering veterans on Veteran's Day.

We had not been to Chili's in a couple of years due to a couple of bad service experiences mainly. We've been to this location now twice in the last couple of months and we are a fan again. They've changed up the menu (their mexican food is decent) and left some classics. The best new addition (they have remodeled) is the ipad esque tablet at the table. Some stuff is free, but if your kid hits the pay option like mine did (oops) you will be charged 99 cents (no biggie, to me it was totally worth it to have an enjoyable dinner without my kids becoming inpatient, cranky etc). You can also pay for your meal on the tablet so no more waiting on the server just for the check.

We travel thru the state a lot and eat at a lot of different chili's locations.  Watched the redskin/eagles game here at the bar and Richie the bartender is the most professional bartender I have met in a LONG time!  Food is chilies food - we know our favorites.  The location had crumbs all over tables - stuff wiped off the tables onto the floor.  Taking one star but I will be back - and sitting at the bar!

I haven't been to Chili's in years, but met up with the wife and friends who have a child and were going there, kind of on a whim.   The queso was surprisingly oddly textured and did not taste like it was made with real cheese or even a velveeta like matter.  I don't know what was in it, but I didn't really care for it.  The chips are ok, however. I got the Baby back ribs which i always got as a young kid going to Chilis.  The ribs were like i remembered them and were pretty decent for not bbq joint baby backs.  My side of broccoli was clearly frozen broccoli and it was rubbery and served not even warm by the time i got it.  Disgusting.  The apple cinnamon side isn't as good as i remember it being 20 years ago, and wasn't warmed appropriately either.  Just like cold apple pie filling from a can.   My wife's Margherita flatbread was kind of a joke.  Not cooked, and had a ranch based sauce all over it, so i have no idea how that fits the theme.  In fact, it tasted suspiciously like their southwestern eggrolls and dip.   Anyway for the price they charge for the ribs, i'd say you definitely don't even get your money's worth for what I paid and got. Bleh....

Came here on a weekday night and it was pretty quiet.  Was seated right away and the staff was friendly.  Their menu is really big and it is nice that they have pay stations at each table.  We had chips and queso to start.  It came to the table and was a strange orange - brown color.  It tasted almost as if there were refried beans mixed into it and the texture was thick. Very strange and I didn't eat more than 2 chips worth. The chips were very good on their own, warm, crunchy and salty , which at least helped this appetizer out minimally.  I ordered the margherita flatbread which is an appetizer to share.  It was quite big with about 9 pieces, but it didn't seem properly cooked.  The crust reminded me of a cauliflower crust almost with how thin and pieced together it seemed.  The inner part was somehow not cooked through to where it had a gooey/doughy appearance after you took a bite.  The actual topping on the pizza did not really scream margherita pizza to me.  The pesto sauce on top also didn't quite match the description of 'drizzle' ... It was more like doused in ranch.  It did not seem like a pesto at all, but just full on ranch dressing.  It overpowered the rest of the ingredients, so it tasted like I was eating undercooked, cheesy ranch weirdness. I didn't try anyone else's meals, so I can't speak to their other items.  This is my first time ever going to chili's and I can say that I wouldn't opt to go back unless under duress. Seems like a good spot for families and my friends daughter seemed to like her Mac and cheese and corn on the cob.....

F*** the haters! This is the best chilis my wife and I have been too. We had chips salsa guac a burger and chicken Cajun pasta and 'twas all scrumptious. Super great service. Slid in and out with little noticing and gave us space but still kept my glass full! Great service guys!

We went here for dinner last night and my kids really like this place. It has a nice Ziosk machine where my son plays game on it. The food was ok, I got the fajitas and the tortilla was a little hard. We also got the chicken fried steak which was good. Food alone I would give it 3 stars but the service was great and deserves 5 stars. I would come here again.
The manager james in the cedar park chiles is awesome! I was very upset at how long the delivery service was taking and he went above and beyond what was necessary to make me happy!

Went in for late lunch, early dinner.  Seated promptly, server came by promptly, drinks served promptly.  We both ordered and my food came out a full 10 minutes before my friends did.  Needless to say, mine was cold but still good by the time my friend's food came out.  Really?  The kitchen can't figure this one out?
Cajun Chicken Pasta is great. the staff in the bar area are very friendly and extremely professional.

After receiving awful service at the chilis on 183/bell we decided to come to this one and we r glad we did..our visit with Ty in the bar was by far the best service we've had in a long time..we try to go when he's working he was that great..thank u Ty for making our visit great..we will definitely be back..

Chili's is Chili's as a national chain, so once you have had their food it is the same at almost all the locations.. honest good food and honest good service when we come here.  I prefer the fajitas, drinks, and the Tex-mex or Fresh-mex bowls and entrees they have. They allow me to eat (mostly) healthy and still have some good food. Bottomless chips and salsa is always a win for me...

Absolutely terrible service. I ordered an entree for two with my mom, the one where you can pick two entrees from a selection of 5 dishes.  The waiter failed to tell us it meant entree only, and that the usual sides are just enough for one peeson. We politely asked the waiter about it and his reply was 'Oh you didn't know?'  My jaw hit the floor with his reply. Then he pulled out his menu and said,  'Yea in fact it even looks like that in the picture. So did you want to order more food?' He says  with a small plate of rice,  on a small plate, and gives it to us. I find out later that he CHARGES us $2 for this literally handful of rice!!  This is to say nothing of the slow wait time despite a near empty restaurant (I now know why) and not a single visit to ask how were doing.  Needless to say, I u will never come back and I would not recommend this place at all. I've been to Chili's around the country and for some reason, this place thinks this service is acceptable. ADDED NOTE I very politely asked him to remove the rice from my bill since they practically forced it on the bill, and my waiter rolled his eyes when I asked. I am not exaggerating, this is the single most rude customer service I've ever received in my life.
Our service was good, but the food was too salty. The wait was unusually long and it wasn't even busy. My chicken fried steak was small but tasty. Overall I was disappointed with Chili's at Lakeline.

9/8/2015 Server: Garrett Manager: Jessica maybe her name is Jennifer Chili's today was not good....normally they're great. I ordered the Honey Chipotle Chicken Crispers... Chicken came out burnt...not edible at all. Sever brought out another dish.

We went here for Happy Hour and sat in the bar area. The service was prompt and attentive. We had some chips and salsa, which is complimentary during happy hour, very nice. The salsa is good and the chips are thin, which I like.  We ordered the smoked chicken wings. They came out and looked and smelled very good. The smoke was readily apparent. They come with a side of smoky BBQ sauce, which tasted similar to Cattlemens bbq, which I do like. The wings had been smoked and then fried, which is a delicious combination. They are on the small side, but I like my wings fried crisp, and it's easier to do that with smaller wings.  This was a very good happy hour treat. I also like the table top system which allows you to reorder drinks and pay your ticket at your table. It's great when you need to leave quickly for a movie or something. No need to flag down a waiter. It was a good experience.

We were here for happy hour and to start off the weekend right. We sat in the bar. I like to sit in the bar at this chili's. We ordered beers,and started off with there chips and salsa. Love there chips. They are thin and Crispy. The salsa was great too. One of the things I love at chili's. It wasn't hot but had a pleasing taste with a touch of lime. We just wanted a snack so we ordered there new smoked wings. They were great. Done to perfection and had a great smoked flavor. They were served with a tangy BBQ sauce that paired with them perfect. Hope they keep these on the menu.

Monday, before any dinner rush, no server, bartenders look, plenty of them, still no one bothers to seat or notify anyone. Finally some one says something to some one else about seating as if it were a chore. Server was fine, food was horrible. Fries, chicken tenders, both tasted like what I imaging chewing on a tire does. The corn cob was just a water soaked log with no flavor. This place has become garbage. I will do my best to not come to this location again.
You can never go wrong with this bartender! Ritchie is amazing! He gets the drinks right ever time. He always remembers that I love drinking "El nino"!

I am so sad to be writing a bad review.we were so excited when chilies was first built.  The few first years seemed fine. There were crowds on weekends and Thursday's . But about 3 years ago I started noticing tables, chairs and floors were also not cleaned well at all between customers.  Dishes were even not cleaned well even recognizing a shade of lipstick I don't wear on my water cup. The restrooms were bad and I could tell the interior was not a priority.  Food seemed to be typical chilies quality though chilies fajitas are among my favorites. So if were craving it we call ahead and pick it up to go.  Unfortunately this is happening a to other chilies in the central tx area s well  I've also noticed issues at their restaurants in Lakeway & san marcos. I hope this gets dealt with I don't want to lose another favorite!

Took a friend out to dinner there for her bday. This is not a place to order steaks (it's not their specialty) the service was ok, took forever to get my margarita & my friend's steak had to be returned because it was originally supposed to have been medium rare, it was well done. So we all finished before he did and he watched us eat which was not cool.... BUT, after bringing it to the  manager's attention, he made it right by giving us a big discount and giving us food vouchers. He was just the sweetest guy ever, very apologetic & so nice.  And as we left & approached my car I noticed a note on it (we parked in the front), apparently someone had hit it. I went inside and asked the manager (Brian) if they had cameras outside & he said they didn't & asked why do I told him what happened. He came outside & saw my car & said " you guys have had such a  bad night, I'm really sorry "  he offered to give us more vouchers to make up for it. How freaking cool is that? I will DEFINITELY be going back to this place.

I  need to take my own recommendations as I just noticed my last review said that I was throwing in the towel.  But somehow I decided this past weekend that I should give this place another shot. I will start by saying that our waitress was efficient and helpful - she deserves to be working at a better restaurant. I ordered the bottomless chili and salad.  My server fell down in this one spot as she didn't bring me any chili until my dining companions received their food.  As an FYI - I have been craving chili for the past several weeks.  This version was simply WAY too salty to eat much of it at all.  It might have worked if you were just putting it on a hot dog - but not as a main dish. I traded it out for a couple of other soups and although they were OK, the salty trend continued and they was no doubt that these were coming out of a big bag. My wife and daughter got the half rack of ribs which were nicely done and quite tasty. We ordered chips and guac for app and it came out frozen.  That was replaced quickly with apologies from the manager - but the replacement was obviously also not fresh. So come to this place is you want to have someone else warm up frozen food from a giant bag but there are many, many better choices in the neighborhood.
Davian, my server was perfect.  I wanted to get in and out quick and he did he's job perfectly.  Food was fast and delicious.  His service coupled with a very fair bill made it almost five star.

I will never go to this Chili's again. The queso that we ordered as an app had a thick layer of grease covering it. Absolutely disgusting. The salsa that came with the queso could have been mistaken for red colored water. The burger we ordered medium-well came out rare and my original chicken crispers were crispy and nothing like the original crispers sold at all other chili's restaurants. Not worth it at all.

My husband and I used to go to Chili's about once a week some time ago, maybe a year or so.  We decided to try it a few months ago and the place was almost empty at dinner time. The food wasn't that good and the service wasn't good even though, as usual, you are told there will be two waiters tending to you.  We decided to go one more time last Friday for dinner.  There were three tables with customers there.  Again, told we would have two waiters.  The music was so loud and was the kind of music that wasn't something that is normally played in restaurants.  We nicely asked the waiter if they could turn the music down a little and he said "no, we have to keep it at a certain decibel level".  Really??  We happened to have an app on our phone that shows decibel levels so we checked and it was 80!  If you're familiar with decibel levels, that's pretty high sitting in a restaurant.  They never turned the music down, the waiter left us to die for drink refills and the food was so bad that I left mine sitting there.  That was the last try for us.  We'll never eat at that Chili's again.  Maybe they should look into hiring a new manager.

Have eaten at a lot of Chili's and this one is a cut above the rest of them. New menu is an upgrade, always outstanding service and reasonable prices. Today had chicken fajitas and Cajun chicken pasta with the guacamole appetizer.  Guac had great texture and a nice zesty flavor, chicken in both the fajitas and pasta was tender and flavorful and the salsa was very tasty but not too hot.

First of all the Ancho Salmon is wonderful! The fried pickles we got were kinda soggy. Overall I think they have gotten better recently , new management?? I'm not sure but I love that they have also expanded their menu to more TeX Mex items .  This location does NOT offer WiFi! Just FYI. I came here for a working lunch hoping to eat and also do some things on my computer. Very disappointing in this day and age that a popular place such as this doesn't offer WiFi.

My last visit to chili's has officially earned its title of the "choke and puke". It was a dead Monday afternoon, Our party of 7 arrived to the ghost town. After the usual confusion of picking a table or a booth, we finally decided on the long booths to the right of the door. We were greeted to slimy seats covered in pepper that i decided was tolerable enough to clean for my family. At 12:15 we ordered queso. What we got was not queso, rather a mix of cowboy stew and corn, and isn't queso supposed to be rather warm? Ordering our meals at 12:30 the waiting games began. With the music blaring 60's disco and 80's rock and roll at full volume i could barely hear it over the TV overhead blasting the olympic games. Now without being able to hear a word my party was saying i decided to eat some chips alone and sip on a soft drink watching two random countries play volleyball against each other. Now its 1:45 and my brain cannot take anymore music banging or volleyball (even though i didnt mind the ladies playing the sport). Only one other party of 2 has entered the building and we still dont have our food. I would have given this review a 1/5 stars because of the wait, the noise, my burger came out cold, and two soups came out way too salty. I honestly feel like the cooks in the back were just having a bad day and couldnt stand working in the same musical environment as we were put through. The only thing keeping this a 2/5 star is that my aunt and uncle's meals were pretty good compared to mine. Wont catch me here anytime soon.
The manager at this location is awesome as she is on top of everything and always checks on her guests.The servers are attentive and fun.

Called the Health Department!  On September 22 I ordered a chicken quesadilla for carry out and their food got me horribly sick with food poisoning.  Reported them to the Health Department.  Stay away !!!!!

Chili's used to be so good - before they started trying to make more money on their restaurants by cutting quality.  I am so tired of the same old mass-produced, pressed chicken in salads, quesadillas, pasta, etc.  The entire menu is lame and tired.   And the gift cards!  where is the card # anyway?  Bad job,  !

The chips at this location are tainted, old grease, RANK!!! on the weekend? Reallly?? Food was not good either.  I was feeding my family from out of town i was embarrassed Wow! change the grease.  Could you at least do Chili's status quo???.

Chili's Guest Management, y'all sent me a link to give you feedback and make this right on my end. However, the link you sent me doesn't send me to any sort of chili's webpage. Well, needless to say this doesn't make me want to frequent your establish anymore than before.

No veteran should eat at any Chili's until the company formally apologizes to Ernest Walker and the "manager" is removed from the establishment due to his racist disposition towards this veteran. This is going viral and it will not stand.

I'm not sure what happened to this restaurant. It used to be a staple for my family and friends and last night was the last straw. It took us an hour and 50 minutes to get in and out, after we were served horrible margaritas twice the food was Luke warm at best and we didn't even get that until we asked for it. Our waitress was flip and flighty and never in sight. The manager Gon cared nothing about his guest and made that clear when we cashed out! I actually was so enraged I walked up to him and told him it was the worst service I have ever had! Also the food was not great. I didn't want a discount I wanted to pay my bill and go since we had already been there for an hour and 15 minutes. He takes my gift card my money and delivered out bill and walked away! At that point he probably could not have consoled me anyway. I feel that I'm always understanding but there was no excuses. Don't go!

Sadly, our family won't be patroning this chilis anymore. We have two kids under two, and ordered take out quite often. We felt like the food was always pretty consistent and tasted good. However recently the takeout orders have been incorrect or extremely late. With kids and two working parents, meals need to be ready on time. Last night was the end for us. My husband went to pick up our to go order, arriving about 20 minutes after I ordered online. Long story short, he was at the Chili's with our two-year-old for almost an hour. 2yo had a meltdown because he was starving, the kitchen just completely missed some of the order and somehow it took almost an hour to remedy. Further, once we finally got the order, it was incorrect and missing items I'd ordered. My husband spoke to the manager who offered no remedy - even as our two-year-old cried, and our order was incorrect. In my opinion, he should've offered to bring our child something to eat, or comped part of our meal. Anything. But he did nothing. Having worked in the restaurant industry myself for several years, I find this a poor showing and too frustrating to continue spending money there.

I've been to this chili's 3 times now.   1st time was for lunch was the 1st person sat at the table for the day.   There was still cheese and more the table...  services was ok at best..  told the manager about the dirty table all he say was sorry and would talk to night manager..   2nd time for lunch was sat at a clean table my server was ok but another was helping with everyone's tables refilling drinks and all as all servers should do.  Wish I would have got her name.  3rd time was also for lunch was 1st to be sat at table and table was still dirty from night before moved tables..  did the 3 for 10.  Salad with oil and vinegar came out picked up the vinegar and what do you know a dead bug floating in it..   asked to talk to manager again what do you know it was the same manager again..  all he should say again was sorry and would talk to night manager again..  it was about 3 weeks today from the 1st visit.   As you can tell the talk didn't do much good..  plus service was super slow sat with nothing to drink more than with something to drink.   No servers was helping other tables out..   guess you can say won't be back to this location.
I regret going there. Portions are extremely small and they really don't care about the feed back.
I'll never go to this place again. Burgers taste like they are made in a factory. Also, the restaurant needs a lot of cleaning. If the dining area looks awful, imagine how the kitchen must look like

I gave it 2 stars because the wait staff haven't been openly aggressive and I haven't found anything in the food like bugs or non-organic matter.  Otherwise, the food is edible.  I took my daughter here once and went by myself. We ordered 2 simple appetizers and a main to share.   The appetizers came first and were edible. The main was okay but they left all the plates on the table, even though many were empty.  We ended up piling up the plates and glasses together like we were the bussing staff and nobody ever bothered to collect them.   I also ordered a cocktail to start.  It came 20 minutes after ordering and with the food.  Since I had wanted to pair a beer with one of the appetizers, they brought it all out at once.  When I asked whether there was any way of having the beer I wanted to pair with the meal and having the cocktail later, without it just sitting there and becoming warm and stale, I was simply told "No. We can get rid of it or leave it here".  Perhaps the waitress hadn't ever actually been to another low budget restaurant like Jim's but that was there response.  Like they were a monopoly! ROFL.   I went back in another time to the bar to watch a game and got someone who was very friendly but again ridiculously slow with the drink and delivered some expensive but low-budget wings.  No wonder the wings place next door is so busy all the time.  It's mediocre wings and a decent price and the drinks come through in less than 20 minutes.  Not a high bar, but it seems too high.  I would have thought you could expect consistent quality from Chilis; albeit not great but you could expect consistency and decide accordingly.  It seems that is not possible any longer. If nothing changes I won't ever go back.  Perhaps they will be sold off.  That is the only hope I can see.

This is our favorite Chili's in the entire city. They are always friendly, and the food is always prepared professionally with fresh ingredients. SUPER addictive! Their drink selection is excellent too, (and ALL their bartenders know what they're doing). They even went out of their way to provide a bonus to our daughter because she was on good behavior. This will always be our go to place for a family evening.

Chili's is Chili's. Pretty standard across the board. You come here to have a cheap, but decent meal that is neither amazing but also never leaves you disappointed. The service at this location is better than some others around Austin, so this place is my go to for a quick and solid meal in Cedar Park.
Got charged for an electronic check out device on the table. Food isn't good enough for this. Won't be back.

Today my grandmother invited me to lunch. I work as a manager in an upscale restaurant downtown and typically don't have the time to eat out with her. Seeing as today was my day off, I agreed to join her for lunch. When I asked her where she wanted to eat, she replied "let's go to chili's."  My heart sank. To be fair I typically do not dine at a place like chili's but after today that will change! From the overwhelming welcome they made my grandmother feel, to the unmatched hospitality they exhibited, my grandmother could not have enjoyed her meal more. Working in a restaurant, I notice specific details and was extremely impressed with one of the hosts, as this young blonde woman was incredibly sweet to my grandmother. Our server, Emily, I think her name was, was overwhelmingly sweet and gracious and kind and made my grandmother who is typically very hard to deal with, feel at ease. For restaurants in the area, the value, food, and service can not be beat! Highly enjoyed today's lunch.

I love it here! I have a great experience every time I come. All the staff/manager are super nice, know how to relate to the customers and give you a pleasant experience. This is the best chilis ive been to by far. I just wish I lived closer. The restaurant is clean all the time and the food is delicious and fast!
Wasn't helped at Chilis for 15 mins because they assumed I needed a translator without asking me first talk about racial profiling at its best.
I don't understand why it is rated so low. Chili's is just that, Chili's, not a high-end restaurant and not fast food, it's in between. I had no issues here, had great service and decent food.

Chilli's needs to print prices on their drink menus!! Kids meal were ok - only includes water. Milk, juice are extra. My ranchero chicken tacos on the lunch menu were good (I added tobasco sauce). My husband's burger was very tasty! A miller lite was $4.25.The "El Presidente margarita" was a rip off at $8+ because it was mostly ice in the shaker and hardly any margarita. If you order the margarita with patron it's $9.60 but gives you much more margarita in the patron shaker. Service was quick at lunch time. Noisy atmosphere - crying toddler at a table nearby and a lady at that same table knocked over her drink.

Finally went back here after 2 years to check it out, the reason why we stopped going to Chili's is because the quality and service got so bad that we just could not bare to go back but of course seeing all the commercials with them making improvements we decided to try again because we really love chili's for food and prices. As soon as we walked in we were greeted and sat down, our server was great and very nice my husband ordered his favorite Big mouth Bbq Burger with applewood smoked bacon and home style fries and I ordered the Big Mouth sliders and I can tell you how good it was we were pleasantly surprised that our food was hot and fresh and the burgers had a charred grilled flavor that we love and our fries were hot and people were coming in for their Birthday and families were there which was great to see and just the overall experience was great I'm hoping this trend continues and we will definitely be going back to this location for sure and my favorite part is they donate to ST Jude's for cancer for children every time I go I donate because it a great cause.

My sister and I love this place. We usually order to go but tonight we sat inside the bar area and our server Hunter was super friendly and didn't disappoint with the grilled chicken bacon and avocado sandwich recommendation. The guacamole is one of the best I've had at any restaurant. We will probably be back within the next couple weeks :)
